Methods for generic groups
The following methods can be equally applied to permutation, matrix and projective groups. We do not refer to them as black-box groups here, as they are allowed to contain code that only works for inputs of the listed types.

The following table gives an overview over the installed methods and their rank (higher rank means higher priority, the method is tried earlier, see Chapter ). Note that there are not that many methods for matrix groups since the system can switch to projective groups by dividing out the subgroup of scalar matrices. The bulk of the recognition methods are then installed es methods for projective groups.
